description: High-difficulty logical reasoning scenarios where the model must determine optimal final matchday scheduling to ensure no teams in the same fight (relegation, title race, European spots) get an unfair advantage by knowing rivals' results beforehand
core_principle: Teams whose fates are interconnected must play simultaneously to prevent tactical advantages from knowing other results

scenarios.title: La Liga 2020-21 Relegation Battle Scheduling

head_to_head_completed.note: If 3-way tie occurs, Elche > Huesca > Eibar in mini-table

scenarios.scenario_question: Given the standings and that relegation is positions 18-20, which matches MUST be scheduled at the same time?

logical_breakdown.step_1: Identify relegation zone: 18th, 19th, 20th positions are relegated
logical_breakdown.step_2: Huesca (33 pts) and Elche (33 pts) are both on edge - could finish 17th (safe) or 18th (relegated)
logical_breakdown.step_3: Valladolid (31 pts) needs results to avoid 18th but likely relegated
logical_breakdown.step_4: Eibar (30 pts) can catch up to 33 if they win, creating 3-way tie
logical_breakdown.step_5: Critical insight: Huesca vs Elche ranking depends on whether Eibar reaches 33 pts
logical_breakdown.step_6: If Eibar wins: 3-way tie possible → Elche > Huesca in mini-table
logical_breakdown.step_7: If Eibar loses/draws: 2-way tie possible → Huesca > Elche in H2H
logical_breakdown.step_8: Therefore: Huesca, Elche, AND Eibar matches are interdependent

answer.reasoning: All four bottom teams' fates are interconnected. Eibar's result determines whether it's a 2-way or 3-way tie. Valladolid could theoretically catch Huesca/Elche if they lose. No team should know others' results.
scheduling_violations_to_avoid: Eibar playing before Huesca/Elche (would tell them if 3-way tie is possible)
Huesca before Elche or vice versa (advantage in managing result)
Any match played after another (cascading information advantage)

scenarios.why_complex: Three-way H2H tiebreaker reverses the two-way ranking, so knowing Eibar's result gives Huesca/Elche crucial information about their own survival strategy

scenarios.title: Serie A 2004-05 Relegation Scheduling

head_to_head_situation.classifica_avulsa_if_all_tied: Fiorentina 8 pts > Bologna 7 pts > Parma 1 pt

scenarios.scenario_question: Three teams are on 39 points before the final matchday. How should the final day be scheduled?

logical_breakdown.step_1: Fiorentina, Bologna, Parma all on 39 points
logical_breakdown.step_2: Brescia on 38 points can join the tie with a win
logical_breakdown.step_3: If all three stay on 39: Fiorentina safe (best classifica avulsa)
logical_breakdown.step_4: Bologna and Parma would go to playoff
logical_breakdown.step_5: But if different results: individual standings matter
logical_breakdown.step_6: Any team knowing others lost might 'manage' their game
logical_breakdown.step_7: Parma has easiest fixture (Livorno) - could exploit information

answer.reasoning: All three teams on 39 points must play simultaneously. If any team knows another lost, they gain tactical advantage. Parma especially dangerous as they have easier fixture and worst H2H - they need others to lose.
answer.additional_note: Brescia match also important as they could create 4-way tie at 39 points

scenarios.why_complex: Classifica avulsa mini-table creates complex interdependencies where knowing others' results allows strategic play adjustments

scenarios.title: 2018 World Cup Group H Final Matchday
scenarios.scenario_question: Japan and Senegal both have 4 points with identical goal difference. Why must both matches kick off simultaneously?

logical_breakdown.step_1: Japan and Senegal tied on points (4) and GD (+1)
logical_breakdown.step_3: Yellow cards: Japan 3, Senegal 5 (Japan leads tiebreaker)
logical_breakdown.step_4: If Japan plays first and loses 0-1 to Poland: Japan at 4 pts, -0 GD
logical_breakdown.step_5: Senegal would know they only need a draw vs Colombia
logical_breakdown.step_6: If Senegal plays first and loses: Japan knows they can afford to lose
logical_breakdown.step_7: Yellow card situation adds another layer of tactical consideration

answer.reasoning: Both matches must kick off at exactly the same time. If Japan knows Senegal lost to Colombia, they know they're through. If Senegal knows Japan lost, they know exact margin needed. Fair play tiebreaker (yellow cards) adds complexity - Japan might deliberately avoid yellows if they know scoreline matters.
answer.what_actually_happened: Both matches kicked off simultaneously. Japan lost 0-1 but qualified over Senegal (who lost 0-1) on fair play. Controversial because Japan deliberately passed the ball around in final 10 minutes knowing the scoreline.

scenarios.why_complex: Multiple tiebreaker levels (GD, goals scored, H2H, fair play) mean teams need to track multiple variables; knowing rival's result would dramatically change tactical approach

scenarios.title: Premier League 2011-12 Title Race Final Day
scenarios.scenario_question: Both Manchester clubs are on 86 points with City having +8 goal difference advantage. How should the matches be scheduled?

logical_breakdown.step_1: City leads on GD by 8 goals (63 vs 55)
logical_breakdown.step_2: If points tied, City wins on GD
logical_breakdown.step_3: United needs City to drop points AND win themselves
logical_breakdown.step_4: If City plays first and wins: United knows title is lost (could rest players)
logical_breakdown.step_5: If United plays first and loses: City knows they can afford to draw
logical_breakdown.step_6: City vs QPR has relegation implications too (QPR fighting to survive)

answer.reasoning: Both title challengers must play simultaneously. City has GD advantage so United needs to outscore them if both win. Neither should know rival's result as it affects intensity of play and tactical risk-taking.
answer.what_actually_happened: Both kicked off at 3pm. City were 2-1 down in 90th minute. Aguero scored in 93:20 to make it 3-2. City won title on GD. Had United known City were losing, they might have pushed harder for more goals.

scenarios.why_complex: Goal difference margin means even if both teams win, the number of goals scored matters for potential swing scenarios

scenarios.title: Bundesliga 2022-23 European Qualification
scenarios.scenario_question: Four teams are competing for three different European qualification spots. Which matches must be simultaneous?

logical_breakdown.step_1: Leipzig (62) could drop to 5th if they lose and Union wins
logical_breakdown.step_2: Union (61) could jump to 4th (CL) with win + Leipzig loss
logical_breakdown.step_3: Freiburg (59) could jump to 5th (EL) with win + Union loss
logical_breakdown.step_5: Each team's European fate depends on at least two other results
logical_breakdown.step_6: Leipzig vs Bayern has title ceremony implications too

answer.reasoning: All four teams' European fates are interconnected. Union needs to know if Leipzig dropped points to push for CL. Freiburg needs to know if Union dropped points for EL. Köln needs Freiburg to slip for ECL. Chain reaction of dependencies means all must play at once.
answer.cascade_effect: If Union plays first and wins but Leipzig plays later, Leipzig knows exact scenario. If Leipzig loses, Union would be playing for CL without knowing.

scenarios.why_complex: Three different competitions (CL, EL, ECL) with four teams creates multiple interdependent qualification scenarios

scenarios.title: Serie A 1963-64 Title Race Scheduling
scenarios.scenario_question: Both teams are tied on 52 points with two 0-0 draws between them. Why is scheduling critical?

logical_breakdown.step_1: Bologna and Inter tied on 52 points
logical_breakdown.step_3: If both end on same points: Championship playoff required
logical_breakdown.step_4: Inter has more wins but that's not tiebreaker criterion
logical_breakdown.step_5: If Bologna plays first and loses, Inter knows draw is enough
logical_breakdown.step_6: If Inter plays first and loses, Bologna can relax
logical_breakdown.step_7: Playoff means extra match - teams want to avoid if possible

answer.reasoning: Equal points with drawn H2H means playoff decides title. Neither team should know if playoff is needed or avoided. If one knows rival lost, they can conserve energy or take risks accordingly. Title of Scudetto is at stake.
answer.what_actually_happened: Both won their matches, finished on 54 points, playoff was held (Bologna won 2-0)

scenarios.why_complex: Playoff qualification adds meta-game considerations - teams might prefer certain outcomes to avoid extra match fatigue

scenarios.title: Premier League 1994-95 Relegation Multiple Teams
scenarios.scenario_question: Four teams fighting to avoid three relegation spots. How should matches be scheduled?

logical_breakdown.step_1: Palace (45 pts) needs one point to be safe
logical_breakdown.step_2: Norwich (43 pts) needs Palace to not gain 3+ points and win themselves
logical_breakdown.step_3: Leicester (42 pts, -32 GD) better than Ipswich on GD
logical_breakdown.step_4: Ipswich (42 pts, -56 GD) worst GD, needs Leicester to lose
logical_breakdown.step_5: If Palace plays early and wins: Norwich knows they need to win
logical_breakdown.step_6: If Leicester/Ipswich know each other's result: tactical adjustments
logical_breakdown.step_7: Goal difference massive between Leicester (-32) and Ipswich (-56)

answer.reasoning: All four teams directly affect each other's survival. Palace result determines if Norwich needs to win. Leicester and Ipswich are effectively playing each other's fate due to being level on points. GD so poor for Ipswich that any goals matter.
answer.note: Blackburn were title contenders, so Ipswich's match also affects title race

scenarios.why_complex: Multiple interconnected battles with goal difference as potential tiebreaker means every goal in every match matters

scenarios.title: CONMEBOL 2018 World Cup Qualifying Final Round
scenarios.competition: 2018 FIFA World Cup South American Qualifiers

final_matchday_fixtures.note: Brazil already qualified as group winners

scenarios.scenario_question: Four South American teams fighting for last two direct spots and playoff spot. Which matches must be simultaneous?

logical_breakdown.step_2: Peru plays Colombia directly - winner takes huge advantage
logical_breakdown.step_3: Chile needs to beat Brazil AND hope Peru/Colombia draw
logical_breakdown.step_4: Argentina needs to win AND hope Chile loses AND Peru loses
logical_breakdown.step_5: If Chile plays first vs Brazil and loses, Argentina knows scenario
logical_breakdown.step_6: If Peru-Colombia plays first, Chile/Argentina know what they need
logical_breakdown.step_7: Multiple interdependent results across different countries

answer.reasoning: All matches must kick off at same time. Chile needs to know Peru-Colombia result to understand if their win matters. Argentina needs both Chile and Peru/Colombia results. Continental qualification affects multiple nations' World Cup dreams.
answer.what_actually_happened: All kicked off simultaneously. Chile lost to Brazil (0-3), Argentina beat Ecuador (3-1), Peru beat Colombia (1-1 then Peru won). Chile and Argentina both at 26 points but Chile 5th on GD, Argentina 6th and OUT of World Cup.

scenarios.why_complex: International window coordination across multiple countries, time zones, and massive national importance amplifies scheduling complexity

scenarios.title: Ligue 1 2016-17 Champions League Spots
scenarios.scenario_question: Lyon and Monaco tied on 65 points with vastly different goal differences. Nice 2 points behind. How to schedule?

logical_breakdown.step_1: Lyon (65 pts, +32 GD) vs Monaco (65 pts, +71 GD)
logical_breakdown.step_2: Monaco has huge GD advantage (39 goals better)
logical_breakdown.step_3: If both tied on points, Monaco wins on GD
logical_breakdown.step_4: Nice (63 pts) needs both Lyon AND Monaco to lose/draw
logical_breakdown.step_5: Nice could jump to 2nd if they win big and others lose
logical_breakdown.step_6: Lyon knows they need Monaco to lose to get 2nd
logical_breakdown.step_7: Monaco knows a win guarantees 2nd place

answer.reasoning: All three teams fighting for different UCL entry stages. Lyon needs to outscore Monaco on points (can't catch GD). Nice needs both to slip. If Monaco plays first and wins, Lyon knows they're playing for 3rd vs Nice. Affects tournament seeding and revenue.
answer.financial_impact: CL group stage vs qualifying round worth €15-20M difference

scenarios.why_complex: Goal difference gap is insurmountable so points race becomes pure, but three-way competition adds Nice as spoiler

scenarios.title: Championship 2018-19 Automatic Promotion & Playoffs

final_matchday_fixtures.note: Aston Villa in playoff positions, Ipswich already relegated

scenarios.scenario_question: Sheffield United and Leeds fighting for 2nd automatic spot. Norwich secure. How to schedule?

logical_breakdown.step_1: Sheffield United (88 pts) leads Leeds (86 pts) by 2 points
logical_breakdown.step_2: Sheffield United has better GD too (+37 vs +24)
logical_breakdown.step_3: Leeds needs to win AND Sheffield to lose to catch up
logical_breakdown.step_4: If Leeds wins and Sheffield draws: Leeds still behind on GD
logical_breakdown.step_5: Leeds playing relegated Ipswich - easy fixture
logical_breakdown.step_6: If Sheffield plays first and wins: Leeds game becomes meaningless for 2nd
logical_breakdown.step_7: Villa in playoffs so Norwich match matters for Villa's playoff position

answer.reasoning: Sheffield United and Leeds both need to not know rival's result. Leeds would alter approach knowing if Sheffield won/lost. Norwich vs Villa affects Villa's playoff seeding (home advantage in semi). All three interconnected.
answer.additional_consideration: Automatic promotion worth ~£170M to clubs over 3 years vs playoff risk

scenarios.why_complex: Two-horse race for automatic promotion with GD backup, plus playoff positioning creates multi-layered scheduling puzzle

evaluation_guidelines.input_format: Standings before final matchday + fixture list
evaluation_guidelines.output_required: Which matches must be played simultaneously and why
evaluation_guidelines.difficulty_level: High - requires multi-step logical reasoning about interconnected outcomes
expected_model_capabilities: Parse standings and calculate possible outcomes
Identify which teams' fates are linked
Understand how knowing results creates tactical advantages
evaluation_guidelines.key_principle: No team should have information advantage that allows them to adjust their approach based on rivals' results

common_scheduling_patterns.relegation_battles: All teams within mathematical relegation danger must play simultaneously
common_scheduling_patterns.title_races: Top teams competing for championship must play at same time
common_scheduling_patterns.european_qualification: Teams competing for same European spot must play together
common_scheduling_patterns.head_to_head_interdependencies: When H2H tiebreakers depend on third team results, all must be simultaneous
common_scheduling_patterns.goal_difference_scenarios: When GD is tiebreaker, teams need to not know how many goals to score

metadata.author: Claude Code
metadata.purpose: Evaluation dataset for testing logical reasoning about fair competition scheduling
